titleInfo.title: O'Meara et al v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - 1) The plaintiffs' motion to amend, (filing no. 17), is granted. 2) The plaintiffs' amended complaint, a copy of which is attached to their motion, shall be filed on or before July 27, 2009. 3) The defendants' motion to dismiss, (filing no. 15), is denied as moot. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (JAB)

titleInfo.title: O'Meara et al v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORADUM AND ORDER - The defendants' motion to stay discovery, (filing no. 22), is granted. The deadline for filing the parties Rule 26(f) Report of Parties' Planning Conference is continued, and the report shall be filed within fourteen calendar days after the court's ruling on the defendants' motion to dismiss. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (GJG)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:09-cv-00157; O'Meara et al v. Heineman et al;

titleInfo.title: O'Meara et al v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER regarding Defendants' MOTION to Dismiss Plaintiffs' First Amended Complaint20. Defendants are given until November 2, 2009, to submit an additional brief throughly discussing the issues underlying their motion to dismiss particularly, the issues of qualified immunity and subject matter jurisdiction. Plaintiffs are given until December 2, 2009, to submit an additional brief responding to the issues and arguments contained in Defendants' new brief. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (JAB)

titleInfo.title: O'Meara et al v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting motions for consolidation of cases. Case number 8:09CV157, filing nos. 36, 37, and 38; case number 4:10CV3020, filing nos. 6, 7, and 8; and case number 4:10CV3021, filing nos. 6, 7, and 8, are granted. Case number 8:09CV157, OMeara, et. al. v. Heineman, et. al. is hereby designated as the "Lead Case." The remaining cases, (4:10CV3020 and 4:10CV3021) are hereby designated as the "Member Cases." On or before March 10, 2010, the defendants shall answer or otherwise respond to the plaintiffs' complaints. The Rule 26(f) Report of Parties' Planning Conference shall be filed on or before April 2, 2010. Member Cases: 8:09-cv-00157-RGK-CRZ, 4:10-cv-03020-RGK-CRZ, 4:10-cv-03021-RGK-CRZOrdered by Magistrate Judge Cheryl R. Zwart. (JAB)

On or before March 10, 2010, the defendants shall answer or otherwise respond to the plaintiffs' complaints. The Rule 26(f) Report of Parties' Planning Conference shall be filed on or before April 2, 2010. titleInfo.title: O'Meara et al v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - The motion to dismiss (filing 41 in Case No. 8:09CV157, filing 11 in Case No. 8:10CV3020 and filing 11 in Case No. 8:10CV3021) is granted.The claims against Defendant Clare E. Mahon brought by Plaintiffs O'Meara, Gerdes, Thurmond, Hyde, Seiler and Botts are hereby dismissed without prejudice or limitations to these Plaintiffs' claims against the remaining Defendants and are dismissed without prejudice to re-filing against Mahon. Plaintiffs O'Meara, Gerdes, Thurmond, Hyde, Seiler and Botts' claims against the other Defendants remain pending. The Clerk of the United States District Court for the District of Nebraska shall adjust the court's computerized record-keeping system to reflect the dismissal of Clare E. Mahon. Member Cases: 8:09-cv-00157-RGK-CRZ, 4:10-cv-03020-RGK-CRZ, 4:10-cv-03021-RGK-CRZOrdered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (TCL )

Mahon brought by Plaintiffs O'Meara, Gerdes, Thurmond, Hyde, Seiler and Botts are hereby dismissed without prejudice or limitations to these Plaintiffs' claims against the remaining Defendants and are dismissed without prejudice to re-filing against Mahon. Plaintiffs O'Meara, Gerdes, Thurmond, Hyde, Seiler and Botts' claims against the other Defendants remain pending. The Clerk of the United States District Court for the District of Nebraska shall adjust the court's computerized record-keeping system to reflect the dismissal of Clare E. Mahon. Member Cases: 8:09-cv-00157-RGK-CRZ, 4:10-cv-03020-RGK-CRZ, 4:10-cv-03021-RGK-CRZOrdered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (TCL )

titleInfo.title: O'Meara et al v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: FINAL PROGRESSION ORDER - No telephonic planning conference will be held to discuss the progression of this case to trial. On the contrary, a final progression order is now issued as set forth in the following paragraph: The Motion to Amend 45 in case 8:09-cv-00157 is granted. Jury Trial set for 3/7/2011 before Judge Richard G. Kopf. Pretrial Conference set for 2/17/2011 at 1:00 PM before Magistrate Judge Cheryl R. Zwart. Depositions due 11/1/2010. Member Cases: 8:09-cv-00157-RGK-CRZ, 4:10-cv-03020-RGK-CRZ, 4:10-cv-03021-RGK-CRZ. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Cheryl R. Zwart. (JSF)

titleInfo.title: O'Meara et al v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting (48) Motion to Extend Deadline in case 8:09-cv-00157-RGK-CRZ; granting (19) Motion to Extend in case 4:10-cv-03020-RGK-CRZ; granting (18) Motion to Extend in case 4:10-cv-03021-RGK-CRZ. The defendants' deadline for filing a motion for summary judgment on the basis of qualified immunity is continued to July 1, 2010. titleInfo.title: O'Meara et al v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER granting 50) Motion to Stay in case 8:09-cv-00157-RGK-CRZ; granting 21 Motion to Stay in case 4:10-cv-03020-RGK-CRZ; granting 20 Motion to Stay in case 4:10-cv-03021-RGK-CRZ without prejudice to the plaintiffs filing a properly supported motion to conduct limited discovery to address the issue of qualified immunity. If, after a ruling on the anticipated summary judgment, this case is not dismissed in its entirety, the parties shall contact the undersigned's chambers, within 10 days of the summary judgment ruling to discuss necessary amendments, if any, to the Final Progression Order. If the defendants do not file the anticipated motion for summary judgment, discovery will resume pursuant to the Final Progression Order. The clerk shall file this memorandum and order in the lead case, 8:09-cv-00157, and spread the text and order to the member cases. Member Cases: 8:09-cv-00157-RGK-CRZ, 4:10-cv-03020-RGK-CRZ, 4:10-cv-03021-RGK-CRZOrdered by Magistrate Judge Cheryl R. Zwart. (GJG )

titleInfo.title: O'Meara et al v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 60 Defendant's Motion to Seal. Defendants' brief in Support of Motion for Summary Judgment (filing 57) and Defendants' Evidence Index in Support of Motion for Summary Judgment and the attached evidence (filing 59) are hereby placed under seal and access is restricted to the court and the parties to this action, including counsel of record. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (JAB)

titleInfo.title: O'Meara et al v. Heineman et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - Plaintiffs' motions to extend the deadline to respond to Defendants' motions for summary judgment (Case No. 8:09CV157, filing 62; Case No. 4:10CV3020, filing 34; Case No. 4:10CV3021, filing 33) are granted, to the extent set forth below; Plaintiffs' response deadline for the motions for summary judgment are stayed until a date to be determined after the court has considered and ruled upon Plaintiffs' motions to conduct limited discovery (Case No. 8:09CV157, filing 63; Case No. 4:10CV3020, filing 35; Case No. 4:10CV3021, filing 34). The court will advise the parties of the new response deadline at the time that it rules upon Plaintiffs' motions to conduct limited discovery. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (AOA) Modified on 7/28/2010 to correct the filing number links of member cases (AOA).
